intro: Euphrasia minima subsp. tatrae, commonly known as the Tatra narrowleaf eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as meadows and forest edges. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces numerous small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
